comments: a(n)/2 is multiplicative because both mu(n) and n are. - _Mitch Harris_, Jun 09 2005b(n) = a(n)/a(1) is multiplicative with b(p^1) = -p, b(p^e) = 0 if e > 1. - _David W. Wilson_, Jun 12 2005
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
prog: (PARI) q=[]; for(n=1,200,q=concat(q,moebius(n)*(2*n))); q(PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b062004.txt", n, " ", 2*n*moebius(n)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 29 2009
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 04 2001
